meanings.definition: A person or thing that deflates.
meanings.sent1: The deflater quickly let the air out of the balloon.
meanings.sent2: The basketball deflater was used to remove the air from the ball.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child acted as a deflater by popping all the balloons at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her harsh words were like a deflater, taking the excitement out of the room.
meanings.sent5: The deflater at the tire shop made the process of fixing flats much easier.

meanings.definition: A device used to reduce the pressure or volume of something.
meanings.sent1: The deflater attached to the pump helped regulate the pressure in the tank.
meanings.sent2: The vacuum deflater was essential for packing clothes efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The deflater in the air mattress made it easy to store when not in use.
meanings.sent4: The deflater in the hydraulic system prevented the pipes from bursting.
meanings.sent5: The deflater on the compressor ensured safe operation of the machinery.

meanings.definition: A program or software that compresses data to reduce file size.
meanings.sent1: The deflater on the computer helped save storage space by compressing files.
meanings.sent2: The data deflater was essential for sending large files over email.
meanings.sent3: The deflater on the website made loading pages faster for users.
meanings.sent4: The software deflater worked like magic, shrinking large documents in seconds.
meanings.sent5: The deflater in the app made downloading updates quicker and more efficient.
